channel.title: [UFC] oppinions on Conor McGregor?
channel.description:
If you don't watch UFC or MMA in general you will most likely not have a clue who he is (unless you're from ireland).
He's got a big fight in Aldo coming up, I think he could be the GOAT in MMA, what do you guys think?

item.title: [UFC] oppinions on Conor McGregor?
item.dc:creator: @Welliton_inc Welliton_inc
item.description:
@Welliton_inc wrote:

He may be c ocky, but he is definitely backing up his words. 5 UFC fights, 4 knockouts. His personality is also bringing in the viewers (and the money), he is apparently making a minimum of $7million for his fight (3x more than Aldo).

I believe he will defeat Aldo, either by knockout or by decision. The real test I believe is what happens once he moves up to lightweight which is undoubtedly the toughest division in the UFC.

Read full topic

item.title: [UFC] oppinions on Conor McGregor?
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

He’s an incredible fighter, absolutely incredible. He’s pretty c_ocky but if I was a tenth as good as what he is when I was still fighting I’d have been every bit as full of myself.

Read full topic

item.title: [UFC] oppinions on Conor McGregor?
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

He’s way to full of himself. Decent fighter though.

he is a talented fighter but damn hes C ocky as hell.
